channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: A day in the life of a USPTO patent examiner
item.description: Do you want a challenging career? Would you like the opportunity to work from home nationwide with a flexible schedule? Do you want to be a part of a culture of inclusivity and camaraderie, and a community that leads America toward breakthroughs in innovation? Are you a U.S. citizen graduating this year with a focus in any of these fields? Biology Biomedical Engineering Chemistry Chemical Engineering Computer Engineering Computer Science Design Electrical Engineering Mechanical Engineering Physics If you answered yes to any of these questions, you may belong at the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) as a patent examiner! We recruit the most promising at America's Innovation Agency, and we encourage you to take the step forward in your journey today by joining us on October 24 at noon ET for an informational webinar on becoming a patent examiner.

item.title: Expanding your market: Copyright protection - RESCHEDULED
Learn the fundamentals of the patent application process
item.description: Do you have an invention you want to patent? Are you unfamiliar with the patent filing process? Are you a first-time patent application filer or new to the Patent Center? Are you unsure where to start?

item.title: 2024 National Patent Application Drafting Competition overview webinar
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) invites law students studying patent law to participate in the 2024 National Patent Application Drafting Competition. The competition introduces students to issues arising in U.S. patent law and develops their patent application drafting, amending, and prosecution skills.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part III: Patent searching
Learn the fundamentals of the patent application process
item.description: Do you have an invention you want to patent? Are you unfamiliar with the patent filing process? Are you a first-time patent application filer or new to the Patent Center? Are you unsure where to start?

item.title: PTAB Inventor Hour - Episode 23
item.description: Are you an inventor, entrepreneur, new practitioner, or just someone who wants to learn more about the United States Patent and Trademark Office and Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB)? Join us Thursday, October 26 at noon ET for the next PTAB Inventor Hour webinar, Episode 23.

item.title: Strategies for protecting and enforcing intellectual property regarding China: What Green Bay and Wisconsin businesses need to know
item.description: Green Bay-area and Wisconsin enterprises doing business in or with China may find their valuable intellectual property (IP) is being infringed upon. Even businesses not operating in China may find counterfeit versions of their products for sale in China or the United States, or their trademarks registered in China without their knowledge. Join us for this free, one-day in-person program where experts from the U.S. Government, IP attorneys, and local business people will share insights on how U.S. rights holders can protect and enforce their IP in China and the United States.

item.title: Empowering Innovations: Celebrating Hispanic pioneers in education and invention
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Office of Education on October 31, 6-7:30 p.m. ET for an illuminating Fireside Chat on Innovation from the Hispanic community. Tune in to this webinar as we delve deep into the intricate dance of innovation, invention, and mentorship.

item.title: K-12 education office hours
Trademark Public Advisory Committee executive session
item.description: Activity Speaker Deliberative discussions regarding pre-decisional confidential information related to USPTO strategic planning and potential recommendations, and discussions on future budget planning of Trademark fees and USPTO operations. David Cho, TPAC Chair

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part IV: Learn how to draft a patent application
Intellectual Property Basics and Helpful Resources
Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. Watch the public session virtually on Webex (TBD). The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled public meeting.

item.title: The Path to a Patent, Part V: Understanding the role of claims in a patent application
China IP: Quarterly legislation and case law update
Getting started with Patent Public Search
Fireside Chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims
item.description: Join the next Patent Trial and Appeal Board Boardside Chat webinar on Thursday, November 16, from noon to 1 p.m. ET, for a fireside chat with Judge Ryan T. Holte of the United States Court of Federal Claims. Judge Holte will discuss the jurisdiction and types of cases handled by the Court of Federal Claims, procedures used in those cases, and best practices when appearing before the court.
